qas.question: Which companies did Nintendo try to get to make a CD add-on for the SNES?
What competing console did Sony release after working with Nintendo?
What did Sony do to develop a CD ROM  to compete with Philips?
What was the name of Sony's CD ROM?
What happened to the deals made with Sega?
What did Sega develop after its first dealings with Philips?

context: During the SNES's life, Nintendo <b4_0>contracted with two different companies<b4_0/> to develop a CD-ROM-based peripheral for the console to compete with Sega's CD-ROM based addon, <a3_0><b5_0>Mega-CD<b5_0/><a3_0/>. Ultimately, deals with both <a0_0>Sony and Philips<a0_0/> <b6_0>fell through<b6_0/>, (although a prototype console was produced by Sony) with Philips gaining the right to release a series of titles based on Nintendo franchises for its <a1_0><b8_0>CD-i<b8_0/><a1_0/> multimedia player and Sony going on to develop its own console based on its initial dealings with Nintendo <b7_0>(the <a2_0>PlayStation<a2_0/>)<b7_0/>.
